revised_title: Quantal Transmitter Release in Identified Inhibitory Cholinergic Synapse of Aplysia
tldr: The authors studied the inhibitory cholinergic synapse in Aplysia and found that a sustained postsynaptic potential can be observed when the presynaptic neuron is depolarized in the presence of tetrodotoxin (TTX). This prolonged potential appears to be due to the summation of quantal events. The study also shows that voltage fluctuations superimposed on the sustained potential are likely caused by chloride ions, while the sustained potential is mainly due to potassium ions. The authors conclude that transmitter is released in package form, producing miniature synaptic potentials.
